author: gcolvin
content:
<@!552133098075193354>  Whether it comes before or after the merge, I think a clear candidate for a future "feature" fork is to pull together our outstanding EVM proposals into a coherent whole.

I've re-opened an [EVM group on the Magician's]( https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/evm-evolution-working-group-formation/3218/3) as a place to start on these and others.

https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/289#issuecomment-811598276

author: timbeiko
content: Thanks <@683653554631868440> ! FYI 2930 is already included in Berlin

author: timbeiko
content:
**AllCoreDevs in ~23.5 hours (Friday April 2, 14:00 UTC)**
Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/289
Stream: https://youtu.be/V-Qz4UN6Z88
Zoom: to be shared here shortly before the call 

Overview of the agenda: 
1. Berlin updates: mainnet fork is happening between tomorrow's call and the next - <@!642887713246150666> is organizing a Cat Herders community call to watch the fork ðŸ˜„ Also, the Berlin EIPs should all be in Last Call (cc: <@!211091239112671234> <@!301186049323958275>)
2. London updates: progress on 1559 implementation, can we get LONDON-YOLO up between the next calls? Status of reference tests for 1559. 
3. Shanghai & The Merge: what are clients' PoV about what the Shanghai focus should be. If it's the Merge, what EIPs from the list in (4) in the agenda should we potentially consider for London? In what order? 
4. List of EIPs being proposed: 3403 (remove refunds), 3198 (`BASE FEE` opcode), 3074 (`AUTH` & `AUTHCALL`), 2537 (BLS precompile, and an EVM384 update), 2327 (`BEGINDATA` opcode), 2677 (limit size of `initcode`), 2935 (historical block hashes in state). All of these have issues lined in the agenda

author: gcolvin
content: Thanks <@!552133098075193354>.  I've opened an actual issue for a new agenda item. https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/292

author: holgerd77
content:
We've now got an EthereumJS VM release v5.3.0 with EIP-2930 Access List generation out:
https://github.com/ethereumjs/ethereumjs-monorepo/releases/tag/%40ethereumjs%2Fvm%405.3.0

 (note that our implementation is not quite as sophisticated as what <@!360491619402776577> is targeting in the go-ethereum implementation tackling some additional edge cases. Would be interesting to compare this a bit in practical usage and see how relevant this will be).

author: trent_vanepps
content: awesome! any chance there are any benchmarks for 2930 that compare pre- and post Berlin costs?

author: holgerd77
content: That would be interesting to see I guess, yeah. Would have to think a bit about that, maybe we can come up with something and ran a couple of tx as legacy and EIP-2930, not sure if we have the capacity to do atm though.

author: trent_vanepps
content: i think Marius is also working on some, I was just curious if you had happened to make any

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yeah sorry forgot about it today, rewrote the whole call a bit. Will benchmark tomorrow

author: kelly06407
content: Hey all! I've put together a document providing some comparisons between EIP2537 and EVM384 which are two proposed paths for enabling BLS12-381 support in Eth1: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DdA1IxSDK5ppC1C2W9uvMW66Y8VToc-vPV5B68ZQvOg/edit?usp=sharing

author: kelly06407
content: Please let me know if you have any questions!
